verses.verse: Now Jacob<WH3290> saw<WH7200> that there was<WH3426> grain<WH7668> in Egypt,<WH4714> and Jacob<WH3290> said<WH559> to his sons,<WH1121> "Why do you look at one another?<WH7200>"

He said,<WH559> "Behold,<WH8085> I have heard that there is<WH3426> grain<WH7668> in Egypt.<WH4714> Go down<WH3381> there,<WH7666> and buy for us from there,<WH2421> so that we may live, and not die.<WH4191>"
Joseph<WH3130>'s ten<WH6235> brothers<WH251> went down<WH3381> to buy<WH7666> grain<WH1250> from Egypt.<WH4714>
But Jacob<WH3290> didn't<WH7971> send Benjamin,<WH1144> Joseph<WH3130>'s brother,<WH251> with his brothers;<WH251> for he said,<WH559> "Lest perhaps<WH6435> harm<WH611> happen to him.<WH7122>"
The sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> came<WH935> to buy<WH7666> among<WH8432> those who came,<WH935> for the famine<WH7458> was in the land<WH776> of Canaan.<WH3667>

Joseph<WH3130> was the governor<WH7989> over the land.<WH776> It was he who sold<WH7666> to all the people<WH5971> of the land.<WH776> Joseph<WH3130>'s brothers<WH251> came,<WH935> and bowed themselves down<WH7812> to him with their faces<WH639> to the earth<WH776>

Joseph<WH3130> saw<WH7200> his brothers,<WH251> and he recognized<WH5234> them,<WH5234> but acted like a stranger to them,<WH1696> and spoke roughly<WH7186> with them.<WH559> He said to them,<WH370> "Where did you come<WH935> from?<WH559>" They said, "From the land<WH776> of Canaan<WH3667> to buy<WH7666> food.<WH400>"
Joseph<WH3130> recognized<WH5234> his brothers,<WH251> but they didn't<WH5234> recognize him.

Joseph<WH3130> remembered<WH2142> the dreams<WH2472> which he dreamed<WH2492> about them,<WH559> and said to them,<WH7270> "You are spies! You have come<WH935> to see<WH7200> the nakedness<WH6172> of the land.<WH776>"
They said<WH559> to him,<WH113> "No, my lord, but your servants<WH5650> have come<WH935> to buy<WH7666> food.<WH400>
We<WH5168> are all one<WH259> man<WH376>'s sons;<WH1121> we are honest<WH3651> men.<WH5650> Your servants are not spies.<WH7270>"
He said<WH559> to them,<WH935> "No, but you have come to see<WH7200> the nakedness<WH6172> of the land!<WH776>"

They said,<WH559> "We,<WH5650> your servants, are twelve<WH8147> brothers,<WH251> the sons<WH1121> of one<WH259> man<WH376> in the land<WH776> of Canaan;<WH3667> and behold,<WH6996> the youngest is this day<WH3117> with our father,<WH1> and one is no more.<WH259>"
Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> to them,<WH1696> "It is like I told you,<WH559> saying, <WH7270> 'You are spies!'
By<WH2063> this you shall be tested.<WH974> By the life<WH2416> of Pharaoh,<WH6547> you shall not go out<WH3318> from here,<WH6996> unless your youngest brother<WH251> comes here.<WH935>

Send<WH7971> one<WH259> of you,<WH3947> and let him get your brother,<WH251> and you shall be bound,<WH631> that your words<WH1697> may be tested,<WH974> whether there is truth<WH571> in<WH854> you,<WH3808> or else by the life<WH2416> of Pharaoh<WH6547> surely you are spies.<WH7270>"
He put them all together<WH622> into custody<WH4929> for three<WH7969> days.<WH3117>
Joseph<WH3130> said<WH559> to them the third<WH7992> day,<WH3117> "Do<WH6213> this,<WH2421> and live, for I fear<WH3373> God.<WH430>

If you are honest<WH3651> men,<WH259> then let one of your brothers<WH251> be bound<WH631> in your<WH1004> prison;<WH4929> but you go,<WH3212> carry<WH935> grain<WH7668> for the famine<WH7459> of your houses.<WH1004>
Bring<WH935> your youngest<WH6996> brother<WH251> to me;<WH1697> so will your words be verified,<WH539> and you won't<WH4191> die." They did so.<WH6213>

They said<WH559> one<WH376> to another,<WH251> "We are certainly<WH61> guilty<WH818> concerning our brother,<WH251> in that<WH834> we saw<WH7200> the distress<WH6869> of his soul,<WH5315> when he begged<WH2603> us,<WH8085> and we wouldn't listen. Therefore this distress<WH6869> has come upon us.<WH935>"

Reuben<WH7205> answered<WH6030> them,<WH559> saying, "Didn't<WH559> I tell you,<WH559> saying, <WH2398> 'Don't sin against the child,<WH3206>' and you wouldn't<WH8085> listen? Therefore also,<WH1818> behold, his blood is required.<WH1875>"
They didn't<WH3045> know that Joseph<WH3130> understood<WH8085> them;<WH3887> for there was an interpreter between them.

He turned himself away<WH5437> from them,<WH1058> and wept. Then he returned to them,<WH7725> and spoke<WH1696> to them,<WH3947> and took Simeon<WH8095> from among them,<WH631> and bound him before their eyes.<WH5869>

Then Joseph<WH3130> gave a command<WH6680> to fill<WH4390> their bags<WH3627> with grain,<WH1250> and to restore<WH7725> each man<WH376>'s money<WH3701> into his sack,<WH8242> and to give<WH5414> them food<WH6720> for the way.<WH1870> So<WH3651> it was done to them.<WH6213>
They loaded<WH5375> their donkeys<WH2543> with their grain,<WH7668> and departed from there.<WH3212>

As one<WH259> of them opened<WH6605> his sack<WH8242> to give<WH5414> his donkey<WH2543> food<WH4554> in the lodging place,<WH4411> he saw<WH7200> his money.<WH3701> Behold,<WH6310> it was in the mouth of his sack.<WH572>

He said<WH559> to his brothers,<WH251> "My money<WH3701> is restored!<WH7725> Behold,<WH2009> it is in my sack!<WH572>" Their hearts<WH3820> failed<WH3318> them,<WH2729> and they turned trembling one<WH376> to another,<WH251> saying,<WH559> "What is this that God<WH430> has done to us?<WH6213>"
They came<WH935> to Jacob<WH3290> their father,<WH1> to the land<WH776> of Canaan,<WH3667> and told<WH5046> him all that had happened<WH7136> to them,<WH559> saying,
"The man,<WH376> the lord<WH113> of the land,<WH776> spoke<WH1696> roughly<WH7186> with us,<WH5414> and took us for spies<WH7270> of the country.<WH776>
We said<WH559> to him,<WH3651> 'We are honest men.<WH7270> We are no spies.
We are twelve<WH6240> brothers,<WH251> sons<WH1121> of our father;<WH1> one<WH259> is no more,<WH6996> and the youngest is this day<WH3117> with our father<WH1> in the land<WH776> of Canaan.<WH3667>'

The man,<WH376> the lord<WH113> of the land,<WH776> said<WH559> to us,<WH3045> 'By this I will know that you are honest<WH3651> men:<WH3240> leave one<WH259> of your brothers<WH251> with me,<WH3947> and take grain for the famine<WH7459> of your houses,<WH1004> and go your way.<WH3212>

Bring<WH935> your youngest<WH6996> brother<WH251> to me.<WH3045> Then I will know that you are not spies,<WH7270> but that you are honest<WH3651> men.<WH5414> So I will deliver your brother<WH251> to you,<WH5503> and you shall trade in the land.<WH776>'"

It happened as they emptied<WH7324> their sacks,<WH8242> that behold,<WH376> each man's bundle<WH6872> of money<WH3701> was in his sack.<WH8242> When they and their father<WH1> saw<WH7200> their bundles<WH6872> of money,<WH3701> they were afraid.<WH3372>

Jacob,<WH3290> their father,<WH1> said<WH559> to them,<WH7921> "You have bereaved me of my sons Joseph<WH3130> is no more,<WH8095> Simeon is no more,<WH3947> and you want to take Benjamin away.<WH1144> All these things are against me."

Reuben<WH7205> spoke<WH559> to his father,<WH1> saying,<WH559> "Kill<WH4191> my two<WH8147> sons,<WH1121> if I don't<WH935> bring him to you.<WH5414> Entrust him to my care,<WH3027> and I will bring him to you again.<WH7725>"

He said,<WH559> "My son<WH1121> shall not go down<WH3381> with you;<WH251> for his brother is dead,<WH4191> and he only is left.<WH7604> If harm<WH611> happens<WH7122> to him along the way<WH1870> in which you go,<WH3212> then you will bring down<WH3381> my gray hairs<WH7872> with sorrow<WH3015> to Sheol.<WH7585>"
